name: TextSuggest
tagline: Save keystrokes. Use autocomplete, expansions and more in any application.
body:
# TextSuggest

**Save keystrokes.** Use autocomplete, [expansions], [math results], [commands] and [more] in any application.

A utility to autocomplete words in the GUI.

[![TextSuggest in action](https://github.com/bharadwaj-raju/TextSuggest/raw/master/img/demo.gif)](img/demo.gif)

Licensed under the [GNU GPL 3](https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.txt). TextSuggest is free as in freedom.

## Install

### Ubuntu and Debian

Get the deb file: [Download textsuggest-git.deb](https://github.com/bharadwaj-raju/raw/master/packages/TextSuggest/textsuggest-git.deb)

### Arch Linux

Get it from the AUR: textsuggest-git

### Manual

Run `sudo ./install.sh`.

## Using TextSuggest

Simply bind the command `textsuggest` to a keyboard shortcut. Type a word, select it, press the shortcut. See TextSuggest give you suggestions. You don't even have to select the word: for that, bind the shortcut to `textsuggest --auto-selection`. You can also use `textsuggest --all-words` for getting all words known.

## Advanced usage

TextSuggest is flexible and has many options. See the [README](https://github.com/bharadwaj-raju/TextSuggest/blob/master/README.md) for full documentation.
